requirements: OpenHands is an autonomous AI agent platform that performs software engineering tasks by orchestrating LLM-driven agents inside sandboxed runtimes

sub_tasks.requirements: Agent Core: a stateful reasoning loop that turns natural-language prompts into a sequence of code/file/system actions via an LLM
CodeActAgent implements the primary loop: prompt → plan → execute → observe → revise until task success or failure
ActionSpace exposes atomic primitives (read, write, run, browse, git, etc.) that the agent can compose into higher-level workflows
Micro-agent subsystem injects domain expertise by keyword-triggered prompt augmentation (global, repo, org, user scopes)
LLM Abstraction Layer: pluggable provider interface (OpenAI, Azure, Gemini, Groq, local, etc.) with retry, routing and cost/quality trade-offs
LiteLLM proxy normalizes provider APIs and enables multi-model fallback
Named config blocks allow per-task model selection (e.g., cheap draft vs. expensive reasoning)
Local LLM support via OpenAI-compatible endpoints (LM-Studio, Ollama, vLLM, SGLang) with GPU acceleration hints
Sandboxed Runtime Layer: executes untrusted agent actions inside isolated environments while mounting project code
Docker Runtime (default): spins up hardened containers with volume mounts, network isolation, and side-car linting tools
Image Tagging System guarantees reproducible environments via source, lock, and versioned tags built from CI
Plugin interface allows pre-installation of languages, CLIs, and services without rebuilding base images
Alternative runtimes: Daytona, E2B, Modal, Runloop, Local (bare-metal for CI), Remote (eval-only) selectable at launch
Security & Control Plane: user-configurable safety gates, confirmation prompts, and analyzers that veto dangerous operations
Confirmation Mode intercepts high-risk actions (delete, network, sudo) and awaits human approval via CLI/GUI
LLM Risk Analyzer and Invariant Analyzer statically inspect proposed commands for red-flag patterns
Secrets Manager injects credentials into sandbox without persisting them in code or chat logs
Interaction & Interface Layer: multi-modal access paths (GUI, CLI, headless, WebSocket, GitHub Action, Slack) backed by a unified event bus
GUI server (React) exposes chat panel, file diff, VS Code editor, terminal, Jupyter, browser preview and status indicator
CLI mode offers interactive conversation, repo init, pause/resume, MCP server hot-load and settings override
WebSocket API enables programmatic action injection and real-time event streaming for external tools
GitHub/GitLab/BitBucket integrations register webhooks so pushes, issues or PR comments can spawn agent sessions
Configuration & Extensibility: TOML-based config with environment overrides, MCP servers for custom tools, and repository-level customization hooks
config.toml hierarchically merges core, LLM, agent, sandbox, and security stanzas; CLI args > env vars > file
Model Context Protocol (MCP) bridges external tools via SSE/stdio transports; proxy servers recommended for production
.openhands/ directory supports repo-specific microagents, setup scripts and pre-commit hooks
Cloud SaaS & Evaluation Harness: hosted multi-tenant service with project-management integrations and benchmark evaluation framework
OpenHands Cloud provides managed runtime pools, repo auth, IP whitelists and REST API for conversation lifecycle
Evaluation Harness parameterizes tasks over SWE-bench-style datasets and records trajectories for regression testing
Planned Jira/Linear integrations will enable ticket-driven agent workflows with webhook delegation
